page.title: 05Jesus Fellowship Church
page.content: The Baptist church in Bugbrooke was revitalized in 1969 when the pastor and deacons were "filled with the Holy Spirit"(Acts 2:4). Since then a large community has grown up round JFC in Bugbrooke with committed members living in Community Houses of up to 30 adults pooling their resources into a common purse. The movement has expanded into nearby counties and the Fellowship have begun a chain of health food shops,a building supply merchants and several farms. The movement has generated much controversy as rumours have spread about what goes on in the church and homes, but much good is being done to rehabilitate drug addicts etc.,and the members are totally committed to their cause.In the minds of many outside the village ,"Bugbrooke" is associated with the Fellowship.
